headline: Spaghetti Cacio e Pepe
description: This spaghetti cacio e pepe recipe is made with cheese, olive oil, pepper, and garlic for a delicious side or simple dinner that's made in 20 minutes.

video.description: Pasta in a simple but tasty sauce.
video.name: Spaghetti Cacio e Pepe

name: Spaghetti Cacio e Pepe

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Reserve 1 cup cooking water, then drain spaghetti.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir garlic and pepper in hot oil until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Add cooked spaghetti and Pecorino Romano cheese. Ladle in 1/2 cup reserved cooking water; stir until cheese is melted, about 1 minute. Stir in more cooking water as needed, 1 tablespoon at a time, until sauce coats spaghetti, about 1 minute more.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely great way to utilize leftover noodles. I make spaghetti fritters as an appetizer from this recipe.

I make this frequently as a side for chicken or fish. The only change I make is I use butter instead of olive oil, which is one of the suggested ingredients. Great side for chicken parmesan when you might not have enough sauce for the spaghetti. So good!
Good. My only dislike is that the garlic is minced rather than sliced. Little crispy garlic chips add great flavor and texture.

This is an amazingly delicious quick side dish. I made using vermicelli & added small broccoli crowns the last 5 minutes to the pasta while cooking. Added pasta and broccoli to the oil, garlic and pepper and added a tablespoon of sweet butter to the recipe. Sooo good!
added crushed peppered bacon ,more cheese and peas
Made exactly as written, except for being unable to find pecorino romano cheese. But it was delicious and easy. Will be making this again!
I added grilled chicken to this. Absolutely delicious.
Extremely tasteful, easy to fix, and delicious. A bold flavor as well, depending on how much you like garlic, you're able to add less or add more
I like it its good and easy to make
Very good to me, I loved all of the flavors and I added a bit more crushed red pepper flakes.

There is no garlic in Casio e Pepe. That's why the translation means "cheese and pepper". Many dishes in Italy do not use garlic but Americans insist on putting it those dishes anyway. I'm rating 5 stars for mine!
Delicious!
This recipe was very easy to make and had a lot of flavor. I only added 1 tsp. of pepper. The reason I only gave it four stars was because it clumps when you add the cheese.
This dish is absolutely fantastic, will be making it more often
Reserve a little of the cheese for drizzling before serving else it gets lost in the sauce and you’ll need more to create adequate zing. I’d also recommend a little more pepper.
I made it with butter instead of olive oil. Turned out good but it needs a little spice then just from the pepper.

We really like the flavor of this pasta but despite adding cheese and pasta water in small increments- still goopy. Not big globs but they were there. Served as a side to Italian Chicken Cacciatore from this site. Again, flavorful and easy but hard to get smooth throughout for me.

This is delicious and quick. Even my daughter liked it, which is a tall order. The only downside is that it is very expensive to make. At least where I live the cheese alone cost $12. Seems like it could also be good with some grilled chicken breast sliced up in it. Will definitely be putting this one in regular rotation.
taste was to die for
Lovely. Easy to make. Repetition to perfect.

This did not turn out so well for me. I think this dish is completely dependant on the quality of the cheese. I thought I was buying a high-quality cheese, but it turned out that it had a chemical side taste, even though it was not a ready grated packed type, but a freshly cut from a slab in a grocery store display. Make sure you like the cheese before you buy it because it can ruin your entire dish
I made this last night and my husband is begging me to make it again. He said it’s one of the best meals I’ve ever cooked. It’s super easy and quick. I added shrimp to mine and it was wonderful.
Too easy to be awesome!
Not enough pepper or my taste isn’t totally back from covid!
I added three tablespoons of pesto & chopped mushrooms.
YUM!
yummmmmmmmm

We tried this sauce recipe with some 3 cheese tortellini from the refrigerator section. I added a bit more minced garlic, half the pepper and the cheese hubby brought was grated parmigiano (forgive him, he’s Scottish) It was a fast, easy, and fantastic, light sauce. Perfect for when I’ve forgotten to thaw something when it’s my turn to cook. Thank you! You made me look like a genius today!
My son loved this. Anything I can get him to eat ( he has autism) is great. The rest of the family liked it too
Amazing!
quick and delicious, had it with leftover roasted chicken
I made this tonight to serve with halibut cheeks I had special ordered. It was a delicious combination. The only thing I changed was to add fresh basil to the spaghetti at the table and lemon juice.
Needs a little less oil than the recipe calls for, but a great recipe nevertheless.
Awesome dish!
Delicious and easy!! Followed recipe exactly!
So simple and delicious. I didn’t have Romano, so used Parmesan.
Such an easy dish and so delicious! I call it Italian mac and cheese

This is wonderful - I'm not a huge fan of tomato-based sauce, and this recipe is so simple and delicious -everyone loved it. The only thing I change now is adding a bit more Romano. or good Parm. thanks!

I have made this basic base recipe often, however, I add chopped sun dried oil packed tomatoes, loads of ground black pepper and lots of fresh lemon juice. When you use lemon juice in this recipe, it helps to reduce the desire for a lot of salt, so use salt sparingly when using lemon juice. This version is very delicious.

I made this for m and my family and since we have such a big family I had to double. I recommend that you make it twice in separate pots because there was to much noodles and it was hard to stir around. It was also pretty peppery so you might want to add less pepper. Other then that it was pretty tasty.
We loved this!

This recipe is awesome! My only note is that 1/4 of pasta water works for 2 servings. I was able to whip up this recipe in 10 minutes, very easy, very good. My only dislike is that it is a little bit salty (not just from the salt).
This was simple and delicious!! I grilled some chicken tenders and served them sliced on top of the pasta and my husband loved it!
I have made this for years! It's great for that pasta craving!

Excellent! Very quick and easy. Simple flavors. On our rotation! I added extra garlic because I love garlic. Served it with yellow squash, onion and garlic sautéed and layered with sprinkles of mozzarella. A glass of Riesling. What a great summer meal! Thank you for sharing
I loved this, but as I have a bad habit of not being able to follow a recipe exactly, I substituted red pepper flakes for half of the black pepper. Otherwise, I followed the recipe to the letter.
I love a good recipe with only 5 ingredients! And I do mean good. Every last scrap was gone.
Here’s my simple addition to an already simply delicious recipe. Just add bouillon, either chicken, beef or vegetable flavored, to the pasta water. The added flavor is an incredible boost to this.
So easy to make!! I added broccoli rabe and some red pepper flakes in addition for extra taste. Grated cheese was also added after for those who did or didn't want it.

I really wanted to love this, but it just didn’t do much for me. While it was very easy to make, it was way too cheesy and didn’t have much flavor at all. Unfortunately I won’t be making this one again
Great recipe. Quick and easy. It my go to.
So delicious! I Love garlic, so I added a little bit more. Otherwise made as is. Used as side dish to a shrimp dish.

Really good.
Be sure to save extra pasta water,
more than the recipe calls for..
great

This was pretty good, but we found it lacking in flavor. I had to use freshly grated Parm because I couldn't find any Romano, so maybe that was the reason? Or maybe I didn't pack the cheese in the measuring cups enough? I'm not sure. We added some salt and that helped a lot. I used freshly ground pepper and I'm glad I did, it tasted great. I wish I had read through all the reviews first, because I just dumped all the cheese right in there and it did get clumpy. Maybe that was another cause for lack of flavor? Either way, we liked it, and I'm definitely making it again, but doing so with Romano (hopefully I can find it next time!) and carefully adding it to the spaghetti.

I used seashell pasta because I didn't have enough spaghetti but the cheese just became a clumpy mess. I added more and more water which helped a little. What is the secret to getting it to become a sauce?
We absolutely loved this. Only had parmigiano reggiano cheese on hand so I used that instead , and it was still perfect!

This is a very basic, yet classic dish, that is quite versatile when combined with many leftovers. I made mine with steamed broccoli and cut up leftover baked chicken cutlets. Add some red pepper flakes, or a touch of some crushed chili peppers additional heat. Simple, economical, versatile and delicious!
This is super fast and easy to make. I do add 2 chicken breast sautéed in garlic to the mix at the end. It makes it more of a meal and more hearty!
My daughter LOVED this dish. We added chicken and peas. Delish!
Followed the recipe and added pancetta as another reviewer suggested. Would add some fresh grown herbs of choice next time. Oregano and or Basil.

My whole family ages 6-45 loved this pasta. I appreciate the tip to stir in the cheese a little at a time. I only used half the pepper and cheese and it was plenty flavorful. I forgot to get pasta water, but regular water worked just as well. So good! I will definitely be making this again.
I will definitely make this again! It was delicious.
Made it exactly as written and it was great! I actually ground whole black peppercorns in a mortar/ pestle and it was nice and peppery!
I absolutely love this simple dish, made as written except I used olive oil instead of butter. Thanks for sharing!

This was good. Served as a side with stuffed chicken breast. Our guests seemed to like it but I can't see it being the star of the show. For me the cheese was a little heavy and I feel the red pepper flakes were a necessity.
Made no changes. It’s delicious, the hubster didn’t care for it.
awesome; i did add more pepper
awesome; i did add more pepper
So easy to make, and not the "typical flavor, the pepper was refreshing!
Very good and super easy. I used Parmesan cheese because that’s what I had. I also added bacon but not necessary,
was very tasty. little to peppery for my taste so I will be cutting that back a little next time
Good recipe, easy to make

A tasty, simple, inexpensive dish. My family lives it! I add a little extra garlic and use 1/2 olive oil and 1/2 butter to suit our taste. Add a green salad and you have dinner for 4 under $10. I also like switching half the Romano cheese for Fontina cheese.
A favorite of mine and easy to assemble.
My 11yo son said it was the best spaghetti he has ever had. It was so easy he learned to make it himself.

This was delicious. I used parmesan-reggiano and the taste was great. 2 tsp of black pepper is on the money. I really enjoyed this and never knew it was SO easy. I used 2 ladles of pasta water and about 2 Cups of cheese. Will make it again.
Utter Italian comfort food. You can skip the frying if you roast your garlic and keep it in the fridge -- mash up a few cloves with a fork and toss with the hot pasta.
Made it exactly as the recipe suggested. I thought it was pretty tasty for basic pasta. My husband loved it.

Yummy!!! We made this, with a few changes, based on other recipes I had read. I used butter instead of olive oil, just for the creaminess. Then, we used bucatini pasta, instead of spaghetti, for a heartier bite. I also split the cheese and used 1 cup Romano and 3/4 Parmesan. Gotta say this is a keeper and SO much better than the cacio e Pepe I recently had in New York at an “authentic Italian” restaurant. I can also say that, while it’s perfect on its own, you could add any number of things to this dish, like shrimp, pancetta, a little veg, etc just for kicks and giggles.
I have added bacon and yes I will make it again!

I make something similar but for heart healthy and calorie count I used whole wheat spaghetti, sautéed garlic, low fat margarine (to desired sauciness). 310 calories, 5 gm fat, 6 grams fiber. The olive oil overwhelmed the taste and the butter tasted exactly the same as margarine. I use Asiago cheese but essentially the same recipe.
Easy to make. Family love the taste of the cheese. Something new to taste.
I just made this. added parsley flakes with the cheese. will be going into the fridge till tomorrows mother's day picnic. but it is delicious!!!!
I really enjoyed this and have made it several times, but I cannot do it without the cheese clumping up.
Delicious and easy! I will definitely make this recipe again!
Terrific!h
To be honest I think adding garlic ruined it. I may try making it again without the garlic.
No,and yes, will make it again.Have made it 3 times.I love it!!!!
Really, really yummy. Made this as written. Only change was more cheese. All I had on hand was the bagged parmesan-italian cheeses mix, and this got eaten all up by 4 hungry boys.
Very tasty and quite easy. I’ll use this recipe frequently.
did not care for this at all
This is so quick and yummy. Make sure to use high quality cheese since it is the star after all!
Very good you need to add more liquid or it’s too dry

My mother made this when I was growing up as one of my favorite comfort foods, but never knew what it was called. 

It's so satisfying on it's own, but is also great with small additions like fresh tomatoes, basil or chicken. 

Makes a great side dish as well.
What a surprise. Excellent. We are still raving about this meal a week later. Try it so easy to make.

Gave it 5 stars because it turned out perfect and it's super easy. I used about 1 cup romano and the rest was a shredded Italian blend. My daughter loved it, but too strong of cheese for me still. I will try it again with just the Italian blend. I guess I'm picky, as I don't care for mac and cheese either, that's too bland.
I made it w/ fresh grated parm & sprinkled w/ a little chopped basil. It was so easy & delicious.
